intro: Tupa assurgens var. portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican tupa, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant is often found growing in moist, shaded areas such as forests and streambanks. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to habitat loss, this species is considered endangered and is of significant botanical interest for its unique morphology and ecological role.
